meanings.definition: The stage of meiotic prophase in which homologous chromosomes pair and exchange genetic material.
meanings.sent1: During pachytenes, chromosomes come together to share information.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study pachytenes to understand how genes are mixed between chromosomes.
meanings.sent3: At the pachytenes party, chromosomes swapped genetic gifts.
meanings.sent4: The dance of chromosomes in pachytenes is like a genetic tango.
meanings.sent5: In pachytenes, chromosomes mingle like dancers at a ball, exchanging genetic partners.

meanings.definition: The thickened regions of a chromosome visible during this stage.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, pachytenes show the dense parts of chromosomes.
meanings.sent2: The pachytenes regions are like bold markers on the chromosome map.
meanings.sent3: The pachytenes spots on the chromosome look like tiny mountains.
meanings.sent4: In the world of chromosomes, pachytenes are the prominent peaks.
meanings.sent5: The pachytenes areas stand out on the chromosome, like bright stars in the night sky.
